p: DRR and CCA represent two different fields that often have complimentary sets of expertise and policy goals. The former focuses more on a multi-hazard approach, learning from previous disaster events to tackle future disasters, and increasing the coping capacity, while the latter concentrates more on climate-related hazards, the projection of emerging issues associated with climate change, and increasing the adaptive capacity [ 21]. The implementation of DRR and CCA is not to be separated from development strategies [ 22], so considering the perspectives of the development sector is also relevant and important.
